newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi Aramco discovers more light crude reserves.
newsitem.headline: Saudi Aramco discovers more light crude reserves.

text.p: Saudi Aramco has discovered new deposits of its Arab Super Light (ASL) crude oil in the central province, Saudi Oil Minister Ibrahim al-Nuaimi said.
"This discovery of new reserves of oil and gas is the 17th such discovery in the central province of the kingdom of Arab Super Light," Nuaimi said.
ASL from Abu-Shaddad-1 well flowed at the rate of 3,500 bpd and gas extraction totalled four million cubic feet per day, the official Saudi Press Agency (SPA) quoted him as saying.
He said Abu-Shaddad-1 was located 130 km (80 miles) southeast of the capital Riyadh and 110 km (68 miles) northeast of Hout onshore field.
He said Aramco will conduct more evaluation of the well.
The state oil firm markets ASL crude in Asian markets.
